title: Tracing Back the Radiance
description: Tracing Back the Radiance is the 16th album of the seriously prolific Jefre Cantu-Ledesma. This is no solo feat, however, there is a raft of talent brought together to create this stunning album. We see appearances by John Also Bennett, Marilu Donavan, Chuck Johnson, Gregg Kowalsky, Mary Lattimore, David Moore, Meara O'Reilly, Jonathan Sielaff, Roger Tellier Craig, and Christopher Tignor.

title: On the Echoing Green
description: Tender gusts of guitar, searing glassy synths, and synthetic shoegaze adjacent beats on ﻿Jefre Cantu-Ledesma﻿'s 2017 album ﻿On the Echoing Green.

title: Colloid
description: Limited artist edition of 25 high quality stereo lathe cut discs featuring original artwork by Akhira Sano and design from Will Work For Good.Satomimagae returns to the rich soils of Hanazono to assemble Colloid, a delicate array of peripheral petals stemming from her most recent album. Colloid presents four diaphanous introspections, combining Satomi’s vocalizations, signature six string strum and atmospheric command into a characteristically self-contained sphere of sylvan, biotic mysticism.Colloid contains four new and selected rearrangements of songs from Satomi’s  soundworld, itself a lifecycle which is constantly transforming from timeworn and felt foundations. The fleeting “Toridasu” layers immersive field recordings of unknown origin (could it be forest, brook, city or harbour?) under pastoral guitar explorations, ushering in both an informal and devotional, enchanting and everyday tone.Entries “Dango” and “Ashi” are both reworkings of previously released tracks, the latter appearing in a different iteration on Hanazono. “Dango” may be the most expansive of the four selections, its unfolding form glittering and glowing with new life. “Kiteki,” the penultimate tune, re-emerges from her 2018 album Potopo, a solemn and pensive song of traditionally lyrical intrigue.Colloid is primed for listeners with a feel for molecular subtlety and biological beauty, and a taste for Satomimagae’s living dioramas of ambient folklore.

title: Conclave
description: "Bring dat ass" as the artist behind Conclave is known to say, and one bar of these grooves will, without a doubt, make you move. A beautiful full length from a Brooklyn rising star.

title: Represencing
description: "Bring dat ass" as the artist behind Conclave is known to say, and one bar of these grooves will, without a doubt, make you move. A beautiful full length from a Brooklyn rising star.

title: Suijin
description: Suijin opens with a glittering call, trembling as it is joined by other sounds and harmonium drones. The album is a meditation in drone and other sonic textures that interest the musician Ollie Tutty. It is not strictly a one-note cloud, but a dazzling, stormy event that introduces an opportunity for reverence with the effervescent possibilities of harmonics in the sounds brought together.

title: Two Tales of Lost Witness Marks
description: This description from the label truly sums about this scatter shot, melt-down quilt of an album: "Ringing modular synth sirens evoke alarmingly huge Southern watersnakes swimming on top of Oconee river. Total trip zone across two sides: brownouts in the sequence of events, dubby fadeouts, and bright jump cuts in space. Teases of cartoon barrlehouse tickling on the keys of a farmhouse piano and tape melt psychedelia."﻿As soon as you figure out where you are, where the album is headed, it will turn. Distant piano trickles in, far beyond a squeal of maybe a clarinet or tenor sax unfurls. Throbbing monologues by a heavily distorted guitar bring forth a new dimension. All in all, ﻿Two Tales of Lost Witness Marks﻿ by ﻿Crazy Doberman﻿ is an incredibly far out journey from a group of eight tuned-in / zoned-out experimental musicians. It sounds as though the jumping off point could have been the last 30 seconds of Bowie's song "Neuköln," and from there...

title: The Healing Music of Rana Vol 3
description: Welcome healing into your life with Randall McClellan and one of the volumes of his magnum opus The Healing Music of Rana. Recorded between 1977-1983 at live performances in Northampton, Amherst and across New England, New York and Quebec Provinces, these performances typically lasted 3 hours and were intended to provide an environment of meditative sound."The name Rana means Sunbreath and has its origin in ancient philosophical concepts that recognized vibration as the fundamental creative force and central principle of the many mystery schools of the ancient world."

title: descension (Out of Our Constrictions)
artist: Natural Information Society with Evan Parker
description: Welcome healing into your life with Randall McClellan and one of the volumes of his magnum opus The Healing Music of Rana. Recorded between 1977-1983 at live performances in Northampton, Amherst and across New England, New York and Quebec Provinces, these performances typically lasted 3 hours and were intended to provide an environment of meditative sound."The name Rana means Sunbreath and has its origin in ancient philosophical concepts that recognized vibration as the fundamental creative force and central principle of the many mystery schools of the ancient world."

title: Contemporary African-Amerikan Music
description: Avant-garde free jazz, featuring Roland P. Young. While Young was working as a DJ at KSAN, an underground rock station in San Francisco, bassist Glenn Howell phoned him often to comment on the music he was playing. "He told me he was a musician and I invited him to come down to the station. We started to talk about music, then decided to get together and play." Vocalist Aisha Kahlil met them through a mutual friend at one of their concerts, and after she came by a rehearsal she was soon invited to join the group.Infinite Sound brought a wildly inventive style, through the three musicians' personal background and imaginative takes on jazz, classical, sounds of the world, and Young's interest in electronic and avant-garde material. They often performed at rallies in support of various causes: Black Liberation, Women's Movement, Anti-War Movement, Gay Liberation... connecting with the burgeoning shifts in society and spiritual awakenings.

title: Temidden Laaghangende Wolken
description:
The Begotten is composed of Jürgen De Blonde (Köhn/de portables) and Brecht Ameel (Razen). This is the debut release of their collaboration, joined by percussionist 
Dirk Wachtelaer. Brooders rejoice on these blazed out, nearly trance-like dirges. The tone is reminiscent of twilight shining down through pine needles on moss below, while perhaps the comet featured on the cover passes overhead, connecting sky and ground in one fell swoop. The repetitive motifs ebb and flow between heroism and failure, depending on where you are seated in the metaphorical bar while they perform. "Klauwzeer" stands as the last track as a form of a way out, with its bright pad, perhaps a sonic character for the tail of the comet...

title: 8-Infinities
description: Steeped in classical training, ﻿8-Infinities﻿ is a project, separate from his work with ﻿Razen﻿, where ﻿Ameel Brecht﻿ looks to detach from traditions and explore modalities of string instruments further. Implementing a mandolin and resophonic guitars, Brecht charges, bends, and graces the compositions with a marvelous sense of pace and dynamism.

title: Constant Run
description: Demi-psychedelic moments in 80s texturized synth pops and whisps. Organizatsiya appear on the B-side.

title: Le Marais
description: Demi-psychedelic moments in 80s texturized synth pops and whisps. Organizatsiya appear on the B-side.

title: Urm
description: Cranial creepers made up from familiar and riddling samples. The buzz of interference becomes a rhythmic device, a struggling oscillator finally breaks free, and each side progresses like a surrealist dream sequence. Granular washes, and what might be a Korg Volca (and might not be...) dot the landscape painted by OYL.

title: Singing Dust
description: A stellar album from 1986 saved from obscurity by Efficient Space. This Australian gem by Robert Welsh, with Ghazal devotional poems translated by Australian poet Francis Brabazon, guitar by Ewan McKenzie and backing vocals by Raine Mormon, is a touchstone of sincere synthesis of the jazz and "world fusion" flavors explored and, occasionally, overused in the 80s. The imperfect pressing of '86 is bested by this new reissue, remastered from original tapes by Dan Elleson and Mikey Young. Here the piano, recorder, xylophone, congas and all are sounded out as close as possible to the vision laid down by Robert. ﻿Singing Dust ﻿is a treasured Australian entry into the canon.

title: Dans le Sable
description: The first new album in 40 years from the celebrated Bay area composer and academic Loren Rush.The title piece "Dans le Sable" (1967-68, 70) covers the first side of the record, of which Charles Shere in the Oakland Tribune (1972) writes: “A surreal opera scene. A narrator dwells on the significance of passing time. A soprano sings Barbarina's cabaletta from Figaro, which describes her distraught search in the sand for a lost pin. The chamber orchestra—mostly solo instruments—plays soft, half-forgotten tunes reminiscent of the Parisian music hall. If Marcel Duchamp wanted to put painting once more at the service of the mind, so did Rush seem to want to make a composition that speaks directly to that thing behind the mind—the point where it connects with the soul. And he succeeded. But only because the work is so brilliantly constructed, so careful in its structure and the timing of its phrases, so well balanced in the disposition of its parts that it quite overcomes the audience.”

title: 1982-85 (LP + 24-page Booklet)
description: After Dinner is from Japan, and they embraced new wave, traditional Japanese music, free contemporary and avant-garde rock in their music. Fronted by the vocalist Haco, it is one-part Kate Bush and another part traditional Japanese music (thank you Julian Cope for the observation), blended with forward thinking, non-linear jazz and sound design "structures."

title: Weisheit Aus Des Kindes Mund Tut Uns Stets Die Wahrheit Kund
description: After Dinner is from Japan, and they embraced new wave, traditional Japanese music, free contemporary and avant-garde rock in their music. description: After Dinner is from Japan, and they embraced new wave, traditional Japanese music, free contemporary and avant-garde rock in their music. title: Dothe
description: Sensitivity and curiosity synergize in these idiosyncratic piano experiments from  Rachel Langlais on the French label un je ne sais quoi. Dothe is conceptually anchored around the sound of two upright pianos in the tradition of John Cage’s seminal prepared piano pieces.The composer takes the listener in an imaginative, soaring direction as she altars the piano’s sound by placing plastic, wood and other materials between the strings. The end result is impressively rich and varied, from minimal and harmonious to frenetic and pleasantly cacophonous.The album name Dothe stems from a term in an Ursula K. Le Guin science fiction novel, which means a “nervous hysterical strength that can be controlled.” Langlais utilizes contemporary digital processing techniques, cutting and slowing down organic patterns into further innovative territory. A captivating release that masterfully plays the edge between graceful and dissonant, fusing contemporary elements with avant-garde history.

title: Cohortes
description: The sound here is as big as some of the kitchen items used to make the percussion devices are small. Pieced together with tin pans, copper dishes, some part of a genuine drum kit and percussive pieces like singing bowls or gongs, this album is a tour-de-force of rhythmic awakenings. Sure to wake you (and maybe your neighbors).

title: Superabundance
description: Beautiful Swimmers' Max D and Jackson Ryland put their brains together to channel Superabundance for Future Times Records.It’s an energy rollercoaster of freaky beats and improvisational play for optimal bliss out affect.  The collaborators tease their way through jungle, jazz funk, house and breakcore, applying their musical knowledge to slip the genres into surprising dimensions. Find yourself nodding your head to the mercurial impulses and being delighted by the experience.

title: Crater
description: ﻿﻿Not a house you've been to before, though many look those you've seen. The conceptual location for ﻿Booker Stardrum﻿'s third album could be something out of a ﻿Dario Argento﻿ film, without the actual horror. Sumptuous, maximalist percussion is the centerpiece and Booker's forté, with acoustic instruments sampled and in agreement with the guiding character of each piece. The pieces are organized with an attitude of chaos and a tight arrangement. Absolutely a stunner of an album, and especially recommendable to those of you who are fans of the late Jon Hassell's last few albums.

title: Elevate
description: ﻿Webb﻿ began DJing as a high school student in Detroit with his friend ﻿Paul Johnson﻿ (unclear, but likely not the Chicago house producer Paul Johnson) and ﻿Jeff Mills﻿. Playing as a DJ trio called ﻿Frequency Sounds﻿ in the burgeoning Detroit house and techno party scene. This 12" features house tracks made in 1997 by Webb.

description: ﻿Webb﻿ began DJing as a high school student in Detroit with his friend ﻿Paul Johnson﻿ (unclear, but likely not the Chicago house producer Paul Johnson) and ﻿Jeff Mills﻿. Playing as a DJ trio called ﻿Frequency Sounds﻿ in the burgeoning Detroit house and techno party scene. This 12" features house tracks made in 1997 by Webb.

title: Above EP
description: New ﻿newworldaqaurium﻿ to sip deeply in and absorb. Three tracks that pitter, patter and shimmer with resonant abandon.

title: Stadspark
description: Belgian experimentalist Hiele crafts daring assemblages of blips, squeaks, squirts, buzzes and vaguely 1950's science lab foley effects on Stadspark. It is an eclectic array of scintillating sonics, sounding like a bit more of a maze than an open road. Makes you wonder what is in store for you upon a visit to this central greenery in the city of Antwerp.This is his 8th release, out on the relatively new label Universal Exports.

title: Golliath Brothers
description: Hard, wonky dancehall influenced sounds from London, The Solomon's and Kemet born members Abba-Gana I, Balthazar Abba Gana and Herb Powers. Dub extended into new sonic realms.The label, Riddim Chango Records, is a record label based in Japan contributes music to built community through soundsystem culture.

description: Hard, wonky dancehall influenced sounds from London, The Solomon's and Kemet born members Abba-Gana I, Balthazar Abba Gana and Herb Powers. title: Separate Elements
description: Initially incepted in 1993, Separate Elements is the masterwork of Prof. Charlie Hooker, a Brighton-based multi-disciplinary artist whose work focuses on glass sphere recording technology and its relationship to natural elements like the wind or the sun. In the two expansively scoped pieces that make up Separate Elements, reissued with love from All Night Flight, Hooker employs a substantial yet shifting amount of sunlight to communicate these organic forces to create a score of overwhelming synthesis. While operating as a world (of echo) of its own, Hooker's approach shares a common cause with the organic works of The Taj Mahal Travellers, Arthur Russell, and Inoyama Land, each of whom relied on the natural world and the spaces contained within to tell their stories and construct their spaces.  Believers of the Chee Shimizu mindset, and there are many, will nod to this with presence and passion.

title: Fishy Tales
description: Compiled from several cassette tape releases between 1983 and 1993, this is the first time Dead Goldfish Ensemble has been released on vinyl. Originally released on the musician Steve Hartwell's own label, Peeved Records, the sound has been remastered for this new presentation of some of the earliest examples of domestic sequencers. Inspired by Kraftwerk's "Autobahn," Hartwell began producing music with a sequencer and the MSX computer (an early Microsoft software architecture). Some of the pieces, like "All the Hands" are polyphonic and playful in their minimalism. Much of this, like most Yazoo recordings, are arranged through layered monophonic tracks. Instead of chords, simple melodic lines dance, repeat, and twist. The music is the epitome of an excited home enthusiast, exploring the burgeoning possibilities that have come to define music production today. Released by the Japanese label conatala.

title: Seashells
description: Blanche Blanche Blanche's first album in 10 years, Seashells sees Zach Phillips and Sarah Smith continuing in the same fiery level of sheer earnest pop - with song narratives eschewing any largely recognized "appropriate" or "proper" topics or themes for pop music. A deceptively lo-fi sound with keyboards, tambourines, tongue-in-cheek electric keyboard a cappella ooohs and more, hides the exquisite control they have of their own style. Don't take it from us, here is what "Blue" Gene Tyranny once wrote to them."I really, really have been enjoying your albums. To me they are a pure modern bop style, but don't let me characterize your writing in any way. They are just quite wonderful. The ever-evolving disjunctive bop stimulates in my mind thoughts of hearing Lambert Hendrix and Ross with a tiny bit of disjunctive Zappa. It is truly thrilling music and I am very privileged to hear it." - "Blue" Gene Tyranny

title: Alinea
description: Spellbinding pieces that exhibit a deep understanding of pace in arrangement and makes great use of just a few sounds. Incorporating vocals, sometimes clear, sometimes looped, whirled and indeterminate, ﻿Kirsten Thom﻿ calls Alinea a meditation on vulnerability.
Tripped out continuations from ﻿SVN's﻿ previous release on Acido. Tape hiss filled experimental dance tracks with swagger and confidence.

title: Albatross EP
description: Knives slice through the introductory drone on ﻿Albatross﻿ as helicopters veer into ear distance. An out-there left of leftfield electronic percussive EP by one half of ﻿Giant Swan﻿. ﻿Robing Stewart﻿ crafted what he refers to as "maximal minimalism" and says he may not be doing music like this again. It sounds rather industrial in sound, and immense though it all comes from one drum machine. It is a brash introduction to the new label ipaadi﻿﻿, a new label begun by fellow Bristol DJ, lecturer and writer ﻿Ifeoluwa﻿.

title: Otto EP
description: Big Ever is the moniker of Thomas McAlister, whose previous releases as Cop Envy on Hypercolour, Templar Sound, Black Opal, Cry Baby Records and Decisions earned him recognition in the underground and beyond. A reputable sound designer and mixer in addition to composition and production, he comes to our lovely local friend's label Incienso with a release that touches on elements of dub techno, breakbeat, and glisteningly haunting sound design. The quality in sounds and arrangements of his work were already noticeably detailed and strong, but for this the space in the mix is brought to a higher level, allowing his distinct voice the space to groove. These are the kind of tracks that can work well for a warm up set, or the other side of dawn. Big ups to ﻿Otto﻿, and hopefully we hear more from ﻿﻿the Big Ever moniker.

title: Hemp is Here
description: A "sonically ambitious" avant-pop record, originally recorded in 1985 by English pop duo Pete Karkut and Maggie Turner﻿. This is a nicely priced repress to satiate all those who have been waiting to avoid Discogs collectors. For fans of the obscure English adventures in music, similar to ﻿23 Skidoo﻿, ﻿Eric Random﻿, or ﻿Woo﻿.

title: Mi specchio e rifletto
description: Thanks to Unseen Worlds, (a Brooklyn based label that spotlights as-of-yet unheralded avant grade music), we have this lovely collection of music by Silvia Tarozzi, entitled Mi specchio e rifletto, or I Mirror and Reflect.Musically the album is infused with avant impulses, free jazz improvisation, and is accompanied by heavenly Italian vocals. Conceptually, the songs' are deeply inspired by the passionate poems of Alda Merini, so much so that Tarozzi spent years setting Merini’s poetry to music, then mirroring it with her own afterwards, the end result being Mi specchio e rifletto. The themes of love, motherhood, and the mystery hidden in the everyday are at the core of these sensitively wrought, beautiful tracks that unfold with cinematic, mystic grace.Flute, cello, electric and acoustic guitar, as well as sax, violin and keyboards are all at work here to create a majestical tapestry. At times there’s even a prog-like conjuring of fantastical musical scenes, as Tarozzi ponders the hidden surrealism within the mundane details of waking life.

title: Stolen Car
description: Unseen Worlds has taken up the responsibility of ensuring the musical output of Carl Stone shall go uninterrupted. In this quotation, we hear him seeking to magnify and dissect music we listen to, yet many of us may not listen to the music he "hijacks." Through his process, his exploration of the inner workings is also less giving us a glimpse into the inner workings, but is instead re-presenting the familiar music to formulate an entirely new experience.He says his purpose is to offer them in new meaning "via irony and subversion," but for us, the listener, we are offered the opportunity to go far beyond an ironic or subversive experience upon listening. As specific as the techniques may be, the abstract sonic playground he builds is an open-ended system for aural investigation that plays on our senses in a most individual way. "These tracks were all made in late 2019 and 2020, much of when I was in pandemic isolation about 5000 miles from my home base of Tokyo. All are made using my favorite programming language MAX. However distinct these two groupings might be they share some common and long-held musical concerns. I seek to explore the inner workings of the music we listen to using techniques of magnification, dissection, granulation, anagramization, and others. I like to hijack the surface values of commercial music and re-purpose them offer a newer, different meaning, via irony and subversion." - Carl Stone, Los Angeles, September 2020

title: Exocursion
description: Exocursion is the newest from Viktor Timofeev in nearly a decade. A pastiche of layered guitar loops, obscured field recordings, and deep tonal excursions - Timofeev's work is a lucid collection of subterranean creatures that look towards the unknown.

title: Genetisis
description: Genetisis is the nom de plume of Ka Baird, Brian Close (Georgia), Bryce Hackford, and Jimmy Tamborello (Dntel) - a once-in-a-lifetime collaboration borne out of each of their solo appearances at Meakusma Festival. As one could imagine, each corner of this collaboration represents each artist's distinct musical language. And as one could also imagine, the patois developed from this performance is a rare and transcendent thing.

title: Stones of Precious Water
description: The phenomenally promising label Morning Trip represses Barry Cleveland's Stones of Precious Water for all the world to hear again. Cinematic, ponderous passages that make you feel like you are choosing a futurist's life or death scenario, like in "Indigo Runes." There is something ancient feeling in all of these pieces, giving reason to track titles like "Fall of Rome" or "Ascension." Recorded in 1986, the sound and vibe are as ever alive today as they were back then.

title: Club Imagination EP
description: Electro adjacent techno from Leipzig's Qnete. The four tracks here are prog flavored in a way like Ian Pooley releases on Definitive or the sunny sides of Vince Watson.  "Exergy" moves through a lush arc unlike many other dance tracks released today. Courtesy of the label X-Kalay.

title: Duologue
description: An emotional collaborative project from ﻿Austin Peru﻿ and ﻿Daniel Creahan﻿ that utilizes found spoken sounds in an appliqué style, enveloped by eerie sound design and micro dub scattered rhythms. Highly recommended!

title: Adam Rock Dissed!!!
description: An emotional collaborative project from ﻿Austin Peru﻿ and ﻿Daniel Creahan﻿ that utilizes found spoken sounds in an appliqué style, enveloped by eerie sound design and micro dub scattered rhythms. Highly recommended!

title: Grey Doubt
description: An emotional collaborative project from ﻿Austin Peru﻿ and ﻿Daniel Creahan﻿ that utilizes found spoken sounds in an appliqué style, enveloped by eerie sound design and micro dub scattered rhythms. Highly recommended!

title: Super VA (Padre Himalaya)
description: An emotional collaborative project from ﻿Austin Peru﻿ and ﻿Daniel Creahan﻿ that utilizes found spoken sounds in an appliqué style, enveloped by eerie sound design and micro dub scattered rhythms. Highly recommended!

title: cocon
description: RAMZi's uniquely gifted ear continues to aid in her creation of instantly recognizable beats. Through her already lengthy output, she has developed a sound all her own. Whether it is watery, filtered percussion sounds or her mysterious melodies, two beats and you know it's RAMZi. A native to Montréal, she continues to bring the heat and impress with her ninth studio album, cocon. Let "coeur dodu" dance with you to a high mountain grassland, or be one with your mRNA vaccine to the tune of "mutation". Wickedly detailed tunes with four dimensional movement, these are some of her most inviting tracks to date.>

title: Hanazono
description: Satomimagae’s Hanazono is an invitation to revel in your immediate and imagined surroundings, to make time and space for guileless curiosity and garden variety enchantment. A tribute to everyday mysticism, Hanazono is an ecology of simple, cyclical refrains and elegiac entreaties cross-pollinating with ludic and layered folk vibrations.On behalf of Satomimagae, a portion of the proceeds from this release will benefit the International Rescue Committee and Sesame Workshop, the nonprofit, educational organization behind Sesame Street, who together give displaced children in Syria, Jordan, Lebanon and Iraq the support they need to learn, grow and thrive.

title: The Early Years

title: Mur
description: BACK IN STOCK"Mir""Mor""Mer""(murmur)""Mar"While the album lacks a title track, it has a title (well, also tidal) sound throughout. Wistful piano intertwines with soft whooshing sounds; indeterminate natural sounds, or perhaps derived from within a synthesizer. Each piece is set to the pace of slow, deep breathing, and while these bear a similarity to another recent Deupree release, Chorus (Dusk/Dawn), there is little in the manner of electronic sounds. Mur casts the piano as a central element and everything else is context, or atmosphere, to the expressive keys.Taylor Deupree is a New York based musician who curates the label 12k, and has been producing a large variety of music - from hardcore techno to the softest ambient. He describes the album title “as if there’s always something about my music that’s like a murmur."

title: Old Enough To Know Better (Sourced Stock)
description: First discovered in an all-time fave dollar bin in a land not so far away, Old Enough to Know Better is a wildly inventive piece of pop obscurity by John Small. Released in 1984 by Harbor Sounds, a label that started and ended with the release of Small’s first and only album, Old Enough to Know Better isn’t the derivative, DIY synth drivel found on plenty of platters of its time, rather a high level production of some truly endearing pop songwriting. Old Enough manages to avoid the pitfall of so many privately pressed rock and New Wave records of the 80s in Small’s genuine admiration and expert application of the pop rock formula. A British transplant to Richmond, Virginia, Small was a charismatic guitar player and venue fixture, delivering the local music scene some real, and authentic, talent amidst the Second British Invasion.With that confidence, a great backing band, and a seemingly reasonable recording budget, Small came up with Old Enough to Know Better. The album isn’t a holy grail, and it isn’t without flaws. But if you remove the constructs of context and let this LP play, it’s just a really enjoyable listen. “I Know It’s Over” is the huge bop here (for those who asked, this is the ??? - ??? from this NTS mix), while both “Strength to Strength” and “Last Chance to Slow Dance” hold their own in other ways. Stock here is limited, priced for discovery, and with that glorious cover artwork inviting you to throw your cool clothes in the hamper and jump in the inviting waters. Quack!

title: Under ~ Between
description: First discovered in an all-time fave dollar bin in a land not so far away, Old Enough to Know Better is a wildly inventive piece of pop obscurity by John Small. Released in 1984 by Harbor Sounds, a label that started and ended with the release of Small’s first and only album, Old Enough to Know Better isn’t the derivative, DIY synth drivel found on plenty of platters of its time, rather a high level production of some truly endearing pop songwriting. Old Enough manages to avoid the pitfall of so many privately pressed rock and New Wave records of the 80s in Small’s genuine admiration and expert application of the pop rock formula. A British transplant to Richmond, Virginia, Small was a charismatic guitar player and venue fixture, delivering the local music scene some real, and authentic, talent amidst the Second British Invasion.With that confidence, a great backing band, and a seemingly reasonable recording budget, Small came up with Old Enough to Know Better. The album isn’t a holy grail, and it isn’t without flaws. But if you remove the constructs of context and let this LP play, it’s just a really enjoyable listen. “I Know It’s Over” is the huge bop here (for those who asked, this is the ??? - ??? from this NTS mix), while both “Strength to Strength” and “Last Chance to Slow Dance” hold their own in other ways. Stock here is limited, priced for discovery, and with that glorious cover artwork inviting you to throw your cool clothes in the hamper and jump in the inviting waters. Quack!

title: Zeichen im Schacht der verschleierten Tatsachen
description: Investigative and curious explorations of electroid sounds by Inkasso on the recently established Osàre who brought you Free Range﻿. Construction-site aesthetic speaks to the sounds heard within, fitting that the name ﻿inkasso﻿ means "debt collection, collecting" in english - pitchy and percussive rhythmic left-field excursions.>

title: Influx
description: On a similar tip to the album by web on Acido, Influx is smooth, major-key ambient leaning techno 12" by the NY based producer Brendon Moeller. Released in 2019, these are four inviting and "cool" tracks for both dancing and the chill out room. "Unfeeling" has the vibe of a crystal lined cavern, complete with some group of mystical creatures, though the track does not answer whether they have good or bad news. You're brought to a place through the tones and waveform weaves, and need to find that answer yourself.

title: Maquishti
description: The first solo debut by Mexican born, New York-based vibrphonist, marimbist, and composer Patricia Brennan. This 2xLP showcases years of developing extended techniques and improvisations, playing with other luminaries like Meredith Monk, Theo Bleckmann and Mary Halvorson. With an air of grace, the rich, thick, resonant tones produced by Patricia from the marimba and vibraphone are of a gorgeous sonority to help instill a sense of calm and wonder. In her own words, "From bowing and bending pitch, to the use of extended effects via guitar pedals, this album reflects my vision for the vibraphone and the potential of all the possible ways it can be played. I wanted to not only incorporate all those techniques in the compositions but also wanted them to become part of my general improvisatory language.”This potential can be heard across the 12 pieces on this album. Most are solely either instrument, but there are moments with electronic effects incorporated. One of the first releases of 2021 we are carrying, out on Valley of Search. We're very happy to have a few in store to share with you.

title: Etrusca 3D
description: Etrusca 3D continues in a similar sonic direction as the Avatar Blue releases, and adds the sonorous narration and diety-conjuring vocals from Francesco Cavaliere to Spencer Clark's playing. Each piece is in reference to an Etruscan spirit. The entire record is like a downtempo trance garden, with a blooming extrapolation of the intuited activities of the Etruscan gods. Supported by the legendary late 80s digital Emu Emax 2 synths, a vintage robotic pall covers the reimagination of the ancient Etruscan society.Etrusca 3D by Etrusca 3D (Spencer Clark & Francesco Cavaliere)

title: Over You
description: "Tester Housing was the short-lived band consisting of mates Bill Tolson and Ken Olver. The duo met during the early 1980s in the burgeoning Southside Melbourne, St Kilda. Pitched along the bayside, St Kilda at the time was full of artists, painters, writers, poets and musicians. The suburb was the type of place where dwellers wore their heart on their sleeve; the sort to be found sharing a jug at the pub after a fist fight. The St Kilda music scene during the late 70’s and 80’s is infamous, breeding the punks, grunters, deadbeats and Bad Seeds."Over You by Tester Housing

title: Fischgeist
description: By repurposing tanks that stored dead fish in the GDR era and utilizing techniques heard on her previous album Musique Hydromantique, Tomoko Sauvage reaches backwards and forwards in the same gesture. Having spent years honing her craft using hydrophones in porcelain and glass bowls, she is able to make full use of everything the large, brick, former water tanks in Prenzlauer Berg have to offer. "Deluge" is the handshake, the greeting. A rushing cacophony begins the piece in a grand scale, and trails away over the course of six minutes to micro-sounds.﻿ Fischgeist﻿, meaning 'fish spirit', brings the listener to the plane of intention set out by Sauvage. The bottomless sounds reverberate us into a lucid suspension and hold us there. A beguiling achievement that is the most interesting release from her yet.Fischgeist by Tomoko Sauvage

Ayoban
description: Combining his Ethiopian background and heights of late 80s digital-synth horn sounds, Shams ﻿record Ayoban is an album of, according to the liner notes "Hararian Ethiopian songs". The Harari region is a state in Eastern Ethiopia that has existed since the 1500s. This album spans a range of music influenced by reggae, disco and Shams' Ethiopian heritage.The album was recorded in Toronto at Studio 92. These original pressings from 1990 are care of Invisible City Editions.

title: Every Mouth Teeth Missing
description: In this epoch, it's a challenge to name many artists as epochal as Joe Seaton. From the cryptic atmospherics of Ondo Fudd to the bright, transcendent 'club' of Call Super, Seaton's work is as consistently enjoyable as it is uncategorizable, always uncovering new layers of sound, context, and design; more aligned with Jazz music than club music. Seaton's latest under the latter, Every Mouth Teeth Missing, comes courtesy of our brilliant friends over at Incienso, adding another chapter in the mystifying story of Call Super.For Every Mouth Teeth Missing, Seaton has (like all of us) shifted out of the exterior of clubs and into the interior of the home, with the work on his latest appropriately reflecting this sheltered-in-place era. Piquant and uncanny sounds of the home, the apartment, the kitchen, evoke a domesticated feeling on this record. On "Welcome New People", the listener is lulled into a lighter and brighter environment as the beat slowly erodes. While on what could be the centerpiece of this work, "Pay As You Glow", featuring the now-trademark cameo from his father, David Seaton, channels the warm glow and optimism of 90's IDM, broken down into a future-jazz style that feels signature to Seaton's uncatergorable work. Call this Interior Dance Music. As always with Seaton's music, it never succumbs to the lifelessness of the technology that creates it, always pushing to make things as free, instinctual, and human as possible. Every Mouth Teeth Missing by Call Super

title: Apologize To The Future
description: "Galaxies spin - ignoring our prayers - fields of gravity - crushing space - waves and particles - glued into place - by the strong and the weak - by the cold and hot - radiating light - to a tiny dot"For Chris Korda's new album, her second on Perlon, she has devoted it entirely to the harsh realities that face our planet. Some choose to ignore, others tackle head on, and Chris Korda brings the discussion into her distinctive realm of sounds. In some ways, these feel like the songs that Laurie Anderson didn't get around to writing. The hope of continuing on this planet means reining in production, moving beyond post-truth, and for people to "grow up and face reality, or we simply won't be around."Sung entirely with a vocoder effect, the compositions are built from systems Korda has developed, inspired by inventory and light artist Thomas Wilfred, that generate rhythms and melodies through a shifting juxtaposition in the arrangements. This is an immensely ambitious project that is unlike anything else around.

title: o o o o o
description: Fantastical, post-club club music, with a keen edge of video game soundscape design. Expressive percussion samples and industrial-network effects. TIP for those who like it slinky.Released on Phase Group.o o o o o by Andria

title: Nova Vida Passada
description: Once or twice a year we receive a visit from Glasgow's Domestic Exile, a label charting its own strange path through the world of homespun, left-of-everything electronic music, based primarily in the Scottish capitol. In a banner year for the unusual and unexpected, they have returned with an LP courtesy of Portuguese artist Luar Domatrix appropriately titled "Nova Vida Passada", or "New Past Life".Familiar to Commend faithful for "Koppa D", their contribution to 12th Isle's Inkosi compilation, an inspired slice of ethereal dembow rhythms, the pieces contained herein should neither disappoint nor uninvite. From the jump of its celestial opening track "Ponte Pedestre" and its accompanying album artwork -- a disembodied Blackberry floating through the cosmos -- Nova Vida Passada invites you into its journey to known unknowns. What follows is a collection of contemporary Portugeuse club music meshed with 90's R&B echolalia, expressed in a way that is both cryptic and open. Tunes like "Sense of Style" sample the lush strings of Soul 4 Real's "Candy Rain" and filter it through a deep-reggaeton similar to Commend favorite DJ Python. On the other end, tunes like "I'll Fly With You" are loaded with fragmented vocal samples that are at once familiar and unfamiliar, as if the future that we are imagining through this music is being heard now.Recommended if you like anything on Equiknoxx, NAAFI

title: Cogitate
description: Just the time-bender we needed, NYC local Promoter's first release on Patience crafts a soundtrack for an inner-gaze. Both sides are born from the same cloth, but are woven in different algorithms. Stippling rhythms that sound like underwater welding and synth pulses like checkpoints on the rig glide through the grooves on this 12". A massive autumnal landing.

title: Room For The Moon
description: “Music knows what she wants,” says Moscow-based artist, Kate NV. On "Room for the Moon," the lyrical follow up to the buoyant minimalism of 2018's для "FOR," NV follows this muse in fluid expression, harmonizing her lunar lullabies with a starry compositional choreography. NV says, “I always let music express herself without pressure, and with or without voice.”  Room for the Moon by KATE NV

title: Pow Wow
description: A re-issue for the wave heads. Stephen Mallinder of Cabaret Voltaire's debut solo album is available again from Ice Machine, a sub label of the Canadian electro imprint Suction Records.Some words from Mr.Mallinder on the scene and era from which “Pow Wow” was born: “It was an interesting, and inspiring, time. The primal caterwaul of punk was dying and lots of really significant things were emerging from the fires. Much looser vibes were in the air and there was a much more exploratory feel. Punk had championed a visceral, anti-intellectual approach but in truth the real characters brought so much more to the table, and what began to happen - from people like The Pop Group to Throbbing Gristle, and emerging scenes from No New York to Factory Records - is we began to embrace the art of it all. There was acknowledgement of the importance of books, films, graphic art, and experimentation with all those mediums. We were just as interested in turning over rocks to see what lay beneath, as throwing them. There was a sense of new magik emerging.”  Pow Wow by Stephen Mallinder

Filterealism is an avant-garde trip mending together fragmented elements of jazz, techno and ambient across nine explorations.Each track on Filterealism is grazed with textured ‘80s synths and echoing extraterrestrial sounds. Although this record features elements of dance music, its intent is to be felt and listened to while exploring the unknown frequencies of the atmosphere.ГОСТ014: Гамаюн "Фильтреализм" by Gamayun

title: A Retrospective
description: Renowned DJ and NTS resident Elena Colombi continues to look beyond via her Osàre! Editions imprint with a look behind at the work of Greek musician Thanasis Zlatanos. At once a collection of fragmented Macedonian folk songs, left-field electronics, and the interstitial spaces between; A Retrospective is an exercise in the kind of world building, forward thinking music that Colombi’s NTS show is known for. From the post-punk he came of age in, to moodier, subterranean electronics, the music which comprises A Retrospective takes the listener on a thoughtful consideration of Zlatanos whole body of work. A record that would not feel out of place within Into The Light or even Dark Entries’ catalogs, A Retrospective unlocks a key piece of Greece’s ever-deepening experimental scene.

title: The Saturn Star
description: Travel to the sublime depths of your conscious with the imagination of Jorge Velez’s The Saturn Star. Each track is a score to an imaginary documentary Velez created where “a 16th century physician-alchemist gets hunted down by the inquisition in Western Europe.”Inviting listeners to enter this space, Velez illustrates a 8 image booklet titled 'Systema’  with intention to be digested while slowly exploring the mysteries of the saturn star.  Velez states "Making music is as visual a process for me as making a drawing. A piece of music that's working is able to take on some fantastic shapes or evoke entire scenes or environments. Creating a story, characters and scenes that vary in intensity make the process of building a score for an imagined film tremendous fun. Listening back [to 'The Saturn Star'] I can still see those 'film scenes' in my mind..."

title: Pop Secret
description: Originally recorded in 1997 and released on CD in 1998, Randy Williams Pop secret is now available on vinyl via Lily Record label. During the time of this recording, Randy Williams stayed on Camp Darby military base in Pisa, Italy for two years; and then moved to the US and recorded Pop Secret in his San Francisco home studio.  Throughout the journey of this record, various experimental elements are felt, heard and sometimes seen. Track "tough guys are cute" is filled with shimmering symbols, metal & punk vocals, funky fat bass lines, and serendipitous synths.

title: Our Time
description: Mood Hut swoons again with new Pender Street Steppers double single featuring tracks "Our Time" and "Falling" in vocal and dub versions. Both songs reflect a funky '80s funk serenade with echoing vocals, buttery bass lines, and groovy drum patterns guaranteed to get anyone in a shoulder groove on the dance floor. Our Time by Pender Street Steppers

title: Desert Haze
description: Giraffe captured our imaginations with erstwhile offerings for Meakusma, Juni (2017) and Shine And Dark (2019). Sumptuous, enigmatic musical curiosities knitting together ambient and free improvisatory influences with psych / kraut flair, quietly theatrical dreamscapes humming and creaking with electroacoustic detail. Sascha Demand thrums guitar, Jürgen Hall plays keys, and Charly Schöppner deftly weaves percussion in ritualistic threads. The three transfer unique and prestigious (if eccentric) careers in music into this superlative project, citing the Viennese School (Schoenberg et al) and the Köln School (for its early electronic experiments) as primary inspirations. Their new album, Desert Haze, arrives via Ali Safi’s wonderful Marionette label, which aptly invokes the influence of “Saharan traditional music of the Tuareg” in addition to these foundations. Recorded and produced at Le Garage, in Hamburg, the first half of Desert Haze was created by combining free improvisation and a serialism "rule set”, layering instruments and structures based “around tone color and pitch analysis of resonating prepared guitar sounds”. Its second half reflects a more intuitive playing style on a pared down set up - “representative of what you may hear when listening to them live”.

title: Beehyden / Sinopia / Contagious / Bagatelle Remixes
artist: MA / Upperground Orchestra / Contagious / Stefan Fraunberger

title: AMA
description: Unique noise / hip hop fusion from Tokyo’s MA, via Morphine Records. Surreal scenes built with a variety of vocal and techniques and muddled field recordings create a kind of collage rap album featuring “ritualistic ancient Japanese lyrics.” Strange and stirring.AMA by MA

title: The Fluid Computer
description: The Fluid Computer is an LP and twenty four page book by Floris Vanhoof, creator of the astonishing Talking Gongs generative work / recording for Edições Cn and other glories for trusted sources Shelter Press, (K-RAA-K)³ and Ultra Eczema.The music of The Fluid Computer is made from 100% DIY apparatuses, field recordings and tape manipulations operating like a curious and entertaining hive / hybrid mind. Both the pieces on the record and the photos in the book reflect a theme: “how multiple images overlap on film, and how waves arising in tiny electronic circuits are transmitted to the outside world”...The Fluid Computer by Floris Vanhoof

title: The World Lies Breathing
description: Kyle Martin and Jonny Nash’s Land of Light project returns seven years after their ESP Institute debut. The World Lies Breathing was devised over two years, and shares a meticulous vision of contemporary abstract composition. Clear and sparse but sometimes sinewy and granular, its eight parts were fabricated from a range of materials -  acoustic instruments resonating unrecognizably, contact microphones recording anonymous entities, and Martin’s self-built modular synthesizer doing most of the rest. Silence, which fills the spaces between sounds abundantly, might be the fourth element in the mix and perhaps the most powerful. The World gently lurches in and out of sonic range, creeping around the edges of consciousness and illuminating small but foundational concepts: minuscule moments of tenderness, the nature of matter, ancient mysteries shimmering beyond the horizon of language. An attenuated string sliding over rusted surface, piano notes plunking like water droplets, split-second apparitions of celestial chords, textured melodies and humming signals bleeped into nothingness.

title: Euganea
description: Phew - five years after The Eupen Tapes, we welcome more hybrid Jazz drills from Upperground Orchestra, a quintet of Rabih Beaini, Tommaso Cappellato (drums), Piero Bittolo Bon (woodwinds/electronics) and Alvise Seggi (Bass / Oud). Fusion for the future.Euganea by Upperground Orchestra

title: Knowledge
description: Ellinor Jackson Knowledge EP is four on the floor house with a smooth driving bass lines and spectacular dancing high hats. The A side features tracks “Corners Couch,” and “Snap Happy” which are both infectious grooves made for the dance floor or to dance around the house. Side B features tracks "Shoddy Shoes” with thick repetitive murky bass lines, spacial textured vocals, and hazy high hats. “Granular Jaunt” is a classic serendipitous sunny house track; with smiling piano chords and pads, funky bass lines, and whimsical fluid synths.

title: Rodeo Sound
description: Isabella shares four raw and rambunctious techno tracks on Rodeo Sound out via Swedeish label Börft. Not for the faint of heart, the 12" thumps without compromise.

title: Stella
description: Rotterdam deejay RAFF debuts hyper functional electro-infused, afrofuturist-inspired house tracks on Stella via BAKK Harbour City Service. Fat, syncopated bass lines nod to groove of the best disco. Highlights include the deliciously infectious “Black” and more sinister percolations of “Pain”.Stella by RAFF

title: CC
description: South London's Klein releases her third Ep, CC; a sound collage exploring the renewal cycle of life, death and experiences as a black women through birth, adolescence and adulthood. CC opens with a beautiful monologue from poet, Diamond Stingily, reflecting on her younger brother’s narratives of expressing memories of life and death as a young child. CC continues to find beauty in emotional complexity while expressing “labyrinthine twists, turns and complex parcels” ending the EP with piece “last chance” exclaiming lyrics “I can’t take this anymore;” a statement many black women have expressed throughout different periods of their life while experiencing day to day social constructs of society.

title: Every And All We Voyage On
Salmo / Sao A Fonte Da Sua Propria Luz
Paris Window Original Score
description: Director Amanda Kramer's score prompt for her puzzling film Paris Window: "warped ambient bumper muzak tension". Ben Babbitt, known for his indie film and game compositions, attends closely to this cue, crafting an eerily fogged soundtrack full of dread and suspense that oscillates between stark minimalism and oppressive layering.

title: King Of Snake
description: Osáre (Italian for 'bold' or 'daring') is a new Amsterdam label curated by DJ, Elena Colombi. The label's first release, King of Snake by US underground producer, Matt Weiner (2MR, Night People) and Lithuanian experimentalist Ernestas Sadau (Pinkman, Digital Tsunami) mend together as Free Range. This collaboration takes off on a transit to celestial metallic atmospheres. Orbiting around the sun's groovy rays, track "Toyota Mirror" lands with an intergalactic funky aura; while "Translucent Ashtray" and "Trip To Nairobi" descend deep into the dark unknowns of the ether.

title: For the Moment
description: Arcane archivists Concentric Circles, the Portland, Oregon-based workshop operated by Freedom to Spend’s Jed Bindeman, present another would-be vanished collection of self-released cassette recordings ripe for re-exploration. For The Moment introduces the composer John di Stefano’s distinctive synthesized, polyrhythmic kosmische music, conceived in transit from San Francisco to Japan, by way of Indonesia. Harnessing the experimental power of the Buchla and Serge modular systems available to him through University studios in 1980s SF, and drawing on a background in percussion, di Stefano expanded his practice through the study of Indian music and tabla, and became particularly influenced by Javanese gamelan music. New age lightwork transmissions carried with dexterous tabla detail (“Compos Mentis”) encounter post-punk musings (as in rhythm machine-driven instrumental “For the Moment” and sassy spoken-word guitar and live-drum slink “Knocking At My Door”). Unhinged ten minute modular, tabla and mallet jam “Nuage” meets its match in highlight “Ng’s Office,” which pairs the twinkling, chromatic gamelan ensemble melody with deft jazz drumming. For the Moment features tracks from early cassette releases on his own imprint Oktron Produktions amongst previously unreleased material from the early 90s.

title: Dark Fields
description: A gem in the recent wave of Spanish industrial and synth music excavations is Dark Fields, originally released by Klamm Records in 1983. Created under the motto "a silence that makes dogs bark," T’s singular effort pairs rough rhythms, unhinged punky vocals and deranged synth-lines scratched with plenty of incidental, staged and fabricated growls, creaks, shrieks and other horrorshow hallmarks. Presented by Madrid label Equilibrio, who provided exquisite solace in their 2018 reissue of Patricia Escudero’s Satie Sonneries.

title: Songs Hurt Me
description: Discos Transgénero present the reissue of musician and performance artist Marnie Weber’s 1989 LP Songs Hurt Me. Weber’s debut solo effort, the songs draw from her performance art mythology, possessed by recurring characters - a deer, an old woman, a courtesan, and a butterfly - from her oeuvre at the time. Oscillating between sweet and sombre plainsong (“Songs Hurt Me” and “The Courtesan”), concrete experiments (“Falling Rock,” “Everyone Loves Olga”), and audacious art rock (“You Are Welcome on My Island,” “The Passionate One”), The Los Angeles artist and member of Party Boys joined with Phillip Drucker (AKA Jackson Del Ray from Savage Republic / 17 Pygmies) to develop this almost Caroline K-esque creation.

title: Knotpop
description: Concentric Circles excavates another brilliant idiosyncrasy from the vault of 80s and 90s independent recording in Knotpop, a gem of lunatic new wave / surrealist mutant pop buzzing with saccharine spoken word by Bay Area duo Ixna. Members Jay Cloidt and Marina La Palma studied at Mills College with Robert Ashley and David Behrman, honoring their mentors' works in equal embrace and disruption of the avant-garde through exploitation of pop music themes with an all-nonsense-or-nothing attitude.  Highlights include the devious downtempo nursery rhyme “I can’t remember,” the drum-machine driven din below gossip-choir in “Somebody Said” and long-form guitar and toy synth jam “Flashlight.”

title: The Pilot
description: About time for another Davy Kehoe puzzle piece to materialize, smoking, from the ether. Two years since the divine Short Passing Game dropped on Dublin’s Wah Wah Wino - the hankered-after platform for founders / operators Omid Geadizadeh, Olmo Devin & Morgan Buckley to commit weirdness with their dearest - The Pilot collects two epic, wailing, side-long jams. On the A side, chugging rhythms, gritty guitar, singing mouth-harp, choked vocals and general synthesized insanity imbue this contemporary Kraut Xanadu with a roisterous house party feel. On the other, a muffled, shadowy and ketted out groove takes hold, with elements of the former jam performing behind a veil of smog. Sources, and the empirical ear, suggest familiar characters from the Wah world worked together on the smorgasbord, with Davy at the helm. Nothing less but always more than we’ve come to expect from this corner of the world.

title: MATstudio 1
description: The cult of Melody as Truth is further embellished with this covetish portrait of the label’s studio, where “many hours are spent...experimenting with new methods, tools and ideas.” This process oriented music-making guided by Jonny Nash and Suzanne Kraft and featuring their intimate circle generates enthralling results, where the organic and the electronic coalesce in objectively beautiful harmony. Framed as two long-form pieces, “In Strange Company He Spoke Softly” and the slightly noisier “The Land Through Which We Pass” are like glimpses into a seemingly endless stream of improvisation happening by a serene canal under the overcast Amsterdam sky.

title: Ooid
description: Bokeh Versions sends an eminent envoy from the Bristol dub planet in Sunun.Processing eons of dub lore through her tangle of wires, mics and harps threaded into a 20-channel desk, this envoy hurtles into the future while paying respect to the past. In her first official release, prepared for with compilation contributions to Limbo Tapes, Sunun channels the mantra naming her monthly Noods show “Everything is Drum.” With ritual purpose, every sound emitted is substantial. Her voice drifts dreamily over pound, crush, flicker and gutteral utterance. To close out Ooid, Avon Terror Corps member Kinlaw fans the flames with a a shattering remix track.

title: Decouple ][ Series  [OOH-012]

title: Genom Grundet
description: The inaugural release from NYC label Patience comes from Swedish voyager Ekolali, who has gifted offerings to Not Not Fun and BAAK, the later in a recent split with Milan W.In the spirit of the label’s naming and vision, Genom Grundet is a shifting, submarine adventure that unfurls slowly, listen-by-listen. Not one for cerebral interpretation but rather for tidal, experiential encounter; two long-form pieces meld vocoder chant, warming organ drone, disintegrating tape delay, blissful guitar plunk and eventually mesmeric, melodic rhythmic channels.

title: Untitled Substance
description: Originally released via his website in 2007 and now re-presented by Elon Katz’s Zero Grow label, Untitled Substance is a bounteous mine of post-club / deconstructed dance music. Ten tracks spanning / scanning jacking / crashing techno, ambient computer-screen shatters, buckling rave and pristine futuristic fuzz, Untitled feels completely at home in 2019 and on the Californian label, following up their de-centering co-release with Palto Flats in 2018 - R. Girardin’s Emotional Music.

title: Workshop XXI
description: Kassem Mosse and Lowtec partner up on this double LP for Workshop﻿.

title: Happiness Is Within Sight

title: Trouble
description: Séance Centre delivers this slice of undeniably New York dubbed-out disco."In 1982, a group of friends deep into post-punk, jazz and dub got together in Mad Professor's legendary Ariwa studio and lay down their youthful interpretation of a NYC disco cut. Their unique take included trombone, vibraphone, piano and an ital dose of tape delay. They called the song Trouble and released two versions (vocal and dub) on their friend Tony McDermott's !Drum! label with artwork inspired by Russian Constructivism. The group, comprised of Justin Langlands, Chrysta Jones, John Schofield, Tom Dixon, and Dave Killen, decided to call themselves A-Team, having no idea that Mr.T and Co. would make them almost totally un-google-able 30 years later. The result of their adolescent studio idealism sounds akin to other disco misfits like Arthur Russell, Maximum Joy, Talking Drums and wouldn't sound out of place on legendary NYC label 99 Records. Remastered with an extended Club Dub for maximum dance-floor action."

title: Elysia Crampton
description: Elysia Crampton's fourth and self-titled album comes rushing, full of maximalist, percussion driven, guitar-smattered candor. Familiar (to those acquainted with Crampton's oeuvre), haunted radio spots punctuate stirring synth chords and polymorphous rhythms, introducing a cast of characters to this self-created album. Released on Break World Records. "Thank you for supporting the new self-titled lp/cd written, performed, & edited by me. None of the drums were sequenced & i played them by hand bc don't know better. Much of the percussion was made from live recordings, some sampled & beat in my room w tio RIP. Some day I'll be able to travel w my drums & guitar. Til then my trusty keyboard will take care of me." - Elysia Campton, Instagram, 3 days ago

title: Dicky
description: Gaul Plus' impeccable Broken Call records delivers an intriguing addition to their NYC-centric catalogue. A wavy hellfire funk record, the only release under Eduardo Unz's name. Emotionally in-your-face bangers to fill your 1980s NYC dance pie.
